Name: Sagnik Ghosh
text:
Firestore finally has a stable function to recursively delete all the Subcollections in a Document. Explained in thread..

Comment on other ways to delete Subcollections within Documents recursively... Would love to hear from you all!#javascript #GoogleCloud #firebase #Coding

Name: Sagnik Ghosh
text: The recursiveDelete() method uses a BulkWriter instance with default settings to perform the deletes. To customize throttling rates or add success/error callbacks, create a custom BulkWriter Instance.

Name: Sagnik Ghosh
text: Note: This is a relatively new feature, so you must ensure your Firebase libraries are updated.

Name: Sagnik Ghosh
text:
Often we use math.floor, math.ceil and math.round for eliminating decimals. 

Instead of using them use “~~” to eliminate decimals for a value.

It is also helpful in increasing performance when it comes to micro optimizations in a code.#javascript #codinglife #programming

Name: Sagnik Ghosh
text:
Stop Optimizing your code in the First Go.

- First Solve the Problem

- Then divide the problem into multiple steps, and try to optimize each step independently

- Then combine them to get the optimized solution.#programming #Coding #beginners

Troubles of Building Internal Tools (A thread)
Me: ‘Can I have access to the admin? I need to add and edit some customer records”

Dev: ‘Hmm, not a good idea. Let me do it for you. But now it’s not a good time.’

Me: ‘…’

Have you ever had this kind of discussion?

Name: Sagnik Ghosh
text: After having conducted 300+ user interviews, we are introducing WorqHat - the first-of-its-kind no-code platform to build your internal tools and set up automations and workflows with your own business logic.

Name: Sagnik Ghosh
text: Sign up here to get early access to our beta! https://worqhat.com#business #team #software #nocode #internaltools #workflows #automation #startups #startupgrowth #worqhat

Name: Sagnik Ghosh
text:
Issue of Data Fragmentation in Industries: A thread 

I was dining with a senior management professional from a heavy fabrication industry today and we happened to discuss digitization and the process of automation in their day-to-day work.

Name: Sagnik Ghosh
text: I told him about how we're currently building WorqHat as a workspace where businesses can build internal apps & workflows. WorqHat brings all their fragmented data to one place reducing the use of shared spreadsheets or single-use SaaS to manage their business operations.

Name: Sagnik Ghosh
text: He is excited about what we are working on. If this excites you as well, send me a DM or visit us at https://worqhat.com#worqhat #internaltools #automation #workflows #business #data #opportunities #nocodelowcode #nocodeplatform

Name: Sagnik Ghosh
text:
Orphaned Subcollections  in Firestore  (A thread):
 
Ever tried to put your cat in the microwave? It's not a good idea, OK? Try doing it, and Catto will come out screaming and angry and bite you with those needle-sharp teeth. That's what I'm talking about when I say "orphaned."

Name: Sagnik Ghosh
text: Orphaned sub-collections are collections that live inside other collections. Deleting a document's data without deleting its sub-collections is like deleting the document without deleting its children.

Name: Sagnik Ghosh
text:
This means you can no longer query the document and you lose track of its sub-collections. Make sure to delete those before you delete the parent collection!

Cheerss !! Happy Coding!!!#firebase #firestore #GoogleCloud #javascript #Coding #beginners #programmers

Name: Sagnik Ghosh
text:
Can successful founders afford to be “nice guys”?
I’m not sure if this is unpopular, but it’s definitely common: a lot of startup founders I know think that layoffs are necessary for the survival of their company.

Here's a thread on my take about it :)

Name: Sagnik Ghosh
text:
Simon Sinek in his book "Leaders eat last" writes that “the true price of leadership is the willingness to place the needs of others above your own.”

Being kind is a choice, and it's also a good one.

You can be successful and kind—they're not mutually exclusive!

Name: Sagnik Ghosh
text: #startups are hard, but kindness isn't. Never let anyone believe that “growth at all costs” is a good thing.

Name: Sagnik Ghosh
text: To fire someone who's been part of the team from the beginning is heartbreaking for everyone involved. It's especially tough when those people are friends or family members who became part of the company because of their faith in you as an entrepreneur and leader.

Name: WorqHat
text:
Peter said, "The day before yesterday I was 10, but I will turn 13 in the next year". Is this possible? How?

Can you figure it out? It’s not that hard.
Let us know your answers in the comment section below.
